startUrls.title: Start URLs
startUrls.description: List of web pages where the actor will start crawling.

proxyConfig.title: Proxy
proxyConfig.description: Proxy servers let you bypass website protections, avoid IP address blocking and view content for other countries. Try to use the proxy if you are experiencing timeout errors.

maxDepth.title: Maximum link depth
maxDepth.description: The maximum number of links away from the Start URLs that the actor will crawl. If 0, the actor will not follow any links. If empty or null, the actor will follow links to arbitrary depth.

maxRequests.title: Total maximum pages
maxRequests.description: The maximum number of pages the crawler will load. It is always a good idea to limit the number of pages, otherwise the actor might run infinitely or consume too much resources.

maxRequestsPerStartUrl.title: Maximum pages per start URL
maxRequestsPerStartUrl.description: The maximum number of pages that will be enqueued from each start URL you provide.

sameDomain.title: Stay within domain
sameDomain.description: If set, the actor will only follow links within the same domain as the referring page.

liveView.title: Live view
liveView.description: If set, the actor will display a live view on the container URL, where you can monitor its progress. Note that the live view has a small performance overheads.

considerChildFrames.title: Probe frames
considerChildFrames.description: If set, the actor will extract contact information also from IFRAMEs. Sometimes, you might not want that (e.g. this will include data from online ads).
